content.rendered:
What is a Medical Assistant?

Medical Assistants work with physicians and are in charge of a wide range of administrative and clinical tasks. 

Where does a Medical Assistant work?

  • Physicians offices
  • Hospitals
  • Clinics

How much does a Medical Assistant make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Medical Assistant is $32,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Medical Assistants?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Biology majors
  • Chemistry majors
  • Biochemistry majors
Search Medical Assistant jobs on Handshake

Medical Assistant skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Medical Assistants succeed in their work:

  • Great communication skills
  • Personable and good bedside manner
  • Ability to stay calm under pressure

What are some common questions about Medical Assistants?

Q: How long does it take to become a Medical Assistant?

A: If you’re not going the four-year route, becoming a Medical Assistant usually takes about 1 year. You can complete the required courses at an accredited community college or at another vocational school.
